triples.name: Evaluation of binary classifiers
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using MCC as a superior evaluation method for binary classification over accuracy and F1 score.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: F1 score is the existing evaluation metric that the paper critically compares against MCC.

triples.name: Accuracy and precision
triples.relevance: Accuracy is a baseline metric that the paper demonstrates has limitations compared to MCC for imbalanced datasets.

triples.name: Binary classification
triples.relevance: Binary classification is the core task that the paper evaluates by comparing evaluation metrics.

triples.name: Confusion matrix
triples.relevance: Confusion matrices provide the foundation for all the evaluation metrics (MCC, F1, accuracy) discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Accuracy paradox
triples.relevance: The accuracy paradox exemplifies the problem that the paper addresses: accuracy can be misleading on imbalanced datasets.

triples.name: Genomics
triples.relevance: Genomics is the real-world application domain used in the paper to demonstrate MCC's practical advantages.
